cli

Interface OutputDevice.Interface

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    IODevice.Interface, NonBlockingIODevice.Interface
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Console, InputFileDevice, IODevice.Java, IODevice.Native, IOMux, NonBlockingIODevice.Java, NonBlockingIODevice.Native, OutputDevice.Java, OutputDevice.Native, OutputFileDevice, SingleCommand, StringDevice, TelnetConnection
    Enclosing class:
    OutputDevice

    public static interface OutputDevice.Interface
    Generic output device interface.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void beep()
      Makes the output device beep.

      Cleans the screen.

      Device closure handler.

      Pushes an end of line to be displayed by the output device.

    • Method Detail

      • openDevice

        boolean openDevice()
        Device opening handler. Should rather be protected, but this is not possible in a Java interface.
        Returns:
        true for success, false otherwise.

      • closeDevice

        boolean closeDevice()
        Device closure handler. Should rather be protected, but this is not possible in a Java interface.
        Returns:
        true for success, false otherwise.

      • put

        OutputDevice.Interface put(java.lang.String J_Text)
        Pushes characters to the output device.
        Parameters:
        J_Text - String to be displayed by the device.
        Returns:
        The output device itself.

      • put

        OutputDevice.Interface put(java.lang.Integer J_Integer)
        Pushes an integer value to be displayed by the output device.
        Parameters:
        J_Integer - Integer value to be displayed by the device.
        Returns:
        The output device itself.

      • put

        OutputDevice.Interface put(java.lang.Float J_Float)
        Pushes a float value to be displayed by the output device.
        Parameters:
        J_Float - Float value to be displayed by the device.
        Returns:
        The output device itself.

      • put

        OutputDevice.Interface put(java.lang.Double J_Double)
        Pushes a double value to be displayed by the output device.
        Parameters:
        J_Double - Double value to be displayed by the device.
        Returns:
        The output device itself.

        OutputDevice.Interface endl()
        Pushes an end of line to be displayed by the output device.
        Returns:
        The output device itself.

      • beep

        void beep()
        Makes the output device beep.

      • cleanScreen

        void cleanScreen()
        Cleans the screen.

      • getScreenInfo

        OutputDevice.ScreenInfo getScreenInfo()
        Screen info accessor.
        Returns:
        Screen info with possible ScreenInfo::UNKNOWN values.

      • wouldOutput

        boolean wouldOutput(OutputDevice.Interface CLI_Device)
        Stack overflow protection.
        Parameters:
        CLI_Device - Other device that the callee device should check it would output characters to.
        Returns:
        true if the callee device would redirect characters to the given device for output. Determines whether the current device would output the given device in anyway. Default implementation checks whether this is the self device.

      • printStackTrace

        void printStackTrace(java.lang.Exception J_Exception)
        Exception stack trace display.
        Parameters:
        J_Exception - Exception which stack trace to display.

      • getNativeRef

        int getNativeRef()
        Native object interface compliance.
        Returns:
        The native reference of the instance.
